citation.article-title: Four new species of Chryseobacterium from the rhizosphere of coastal sand dune plants, Chryseobacterium elymi sp. nov., Chryseobacterium hagamense sp. nov., Chryseobacterium lathyri sp. nov. and Chryseobacterium rhizosphaerae sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Chryseobacterium elymi sp. nov.
(el.ly'mi. N.L. gen. n. elymi of Elymus, the generic name of wild rye).
Good growth is observed on TSA, nutrient agar and R2A agar, and weak growth on MacConkey agar.
Colonies are yellowish, circular and shiny.
The optimal temperature for growth is 30–37 °C.
Growth occurs at 10–37 °C, but not at 5 and 42 °C.
The pH range for growth is pH 6–10, and that for optimal growth is pH 7.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–4% (w/v) NaCl within 14 days.
The fatty acid composition is given in Table 2.
The DNA G+C content is 36.4 mol%.
Acid is produced from D-fructose, glycerol, lactose (weakly), maltose, D-mannitol, trehalose, and D-xylose (weakly) but not from L-arabinose.

The following compounds are utilized as sole carbon sources: α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, glycogen, Tween 40, D-fructose, D-galactose, gentiobiose, α-D-glucose, methyl β-D-glucoside, D-psicose, D-raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-sorbitol, acetic acid, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, formic acid, D-galactonic acid lactone, D-galacturonic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, DL-lactic acid, succinic acid, glucuronamide, L-alaninamide, L-alanine, hydroxy-L-proline, L-leucine, L-ornithine, L-phenylalanine, L-proline, urocanic acid, inosine, uridine, thymidine, phenylethylamine, putrescine, N-acetyl-D-galactosamine, adonitol (weakly), L-arabinose, D-arabitol, α-D-lactose, lactulose, maltose, mannitol, D-mannose, sucrose, D-trehalose, turanose, xylitol, methyl pyruvate, monomethyl succinate, D-gluconic acid, D-glucuronic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, malonic acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, D-saccharic acid, sebacic acid, succinamic acid, L-alanyl glycine, L-asparagine, L-aspartic acid, L-glutamic acid, glycyl L-aspartic acid, glycyl L-glutamic acid, L-pyroglutamic acid, L-serine, L-threonine, DL-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid, 2-aminoethanol, 2,3-butanediol, glycerol, DL-α-glycerol phosphate and α-glucose-1-phosphate.

The following compounds are not utilized as sole carbon sources: Tween 80, i-erythritol, L-fucose, D-melibiose, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, itaconic acid, bromosuccinic acid, D-alanine, L-histidine, N-acetyl-D-glucosamine, D-cellobiose, myo-inositol, D-glucosaminic acid, D-serine and D-glucose-6-phosphate.
Other properties are given in Table 1.
Results from API ZYM tests are given in Supplementary Table S1.
The type strain is RHA3-1T (=KCTC 22547T=NBRC 105251T), which was isolated from the rhizosphere of wild rye (Elymus mollis) growing in a coastal sand dune area.
